snippet.title: Ben Browder Got That Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 Cameo Because James Gunn Loves Farscape
snippet.content:
It's pretty great being a science fiction fan in general, but it's especially awesome when you're directing a multi-million dollar movie and can coax your favourite star into appearing in your film. A luxury clearly afforded to James Gunn.
Still: YouTube
Gunn recently shared an image on Instagram of himself and Ben Browder (Farscape, Stargate SG-1) chilling on the set of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 in between takes. According to Gunn, they're talking about one of Gunn's favourite shows, Farscape. Browder, who played John Crichton on the show, made a cameo in Guardians 2 as Sovereign Admiral. Gunn further explained that Farscape is one of his favourite science fiction shows ever and that's why he asked Browder to stop by, get painted up in gold, and help Ayesha hunt down the Guardians.
Browder isn't the only cameo from a beloved science fiction show that Gunn tried to put in Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2. Nathan Fillion that was cut from the final product.
[]
WATCH MORE: Entertainment News
